The force needed can vary significantly depending on the severity of the dislocation, the patient's physiology, and the method used. Reducing a dislocated wrist is a specialized medical procedure typically performed by trained healthcare professionals who carefully apply controlled force.

If you suspect a wrist dislocation, it is crucial to seek immediate medical attention rather than attempting to reposition it yourself or with tools, as improper handling can cause further injury.
